title: Great British Bake Off’s David sparks huge debate over lidless pies
text:
David sparked a huge debate over his Bake Off creation (Picture: Channel 4)

Great British Bake Off viewers have been left fuming over David Atherton’s pie creation – or lack of it…

The 36-year-old sparked a huge debate after he whipped up a pie in the latest installment of the Channel 4 show, but failed to give it a lid.

For the showstopper, the quarter-finalists were tasked with making a vertical pie, consisting of three separate pies stacked on top of each other.

Because the judges don’t like to make anything easy, these days.

But David unwittingly had everyone talking in the tent – and at home – with his creation, after he revealed he wasn’t putting a lid on his pie.

A lidless pie, if you will.

David made a lidless pie on Bake Off (Picture: Channel 4)

However, absolutely no one was keen on his bake, with fans at home begging him to put a top on it.

Flocking to Twitter, one fumed: ‘No lid. No pie. Good bye #GBBO.’

‘Topless pies? No no no that’s not a pie #GBBO,’ another commented.

A viewer screamed: ‘FOR THE LOVE OF GOD DAVID – PUT A LID ON YOUR BLOODY PIE! PLEASE! #gbbo.’

While another fumed: ‘AN OPEN PIE IS A TART, NOT A PIE #GBBO.’

And Paul Hollywood got the ultimate dig in there, adding that David’s three-pie pie needed a lattice roof to enclose it.

‘The design is very good,’ the judge told him.

‘The exposed veg I don’t really like. It needs to be more of a latticing to enclose it for me.’

Luckily, David’s lidless pie wasn’t a total travesty, with Henry eventually going home instead.

But a warning for next time, always put a top on your pie…

Great British Bake Off continues on Tuesdays, at 8pm, on Channel 4.
